content.title: Your service application has been refused
content.mainHeading: Your '{{ serviceName }}' application has been refused

serviceRefusalInfo.bailiff: The court has refused your application for '{{ serviceName }}'.
serviceRefusalInfo.deemed: The court has refused your application for '{{ serviceName }}' that your {{ divorceWho }} received the divorce application.
serviceRefusalInfo.dispensed: The court has refused your application to '{{ serviceName }}' that your {{ divorceWho }} doesn’t have to be served the divorce application.

content.refusalDocumentInfo: You can read the court’s reasons for this in the '{{ refusalDocumentLabel }}' document in 'Download your documents'.
content.infoToContactRespondent: If you still can’t get in contact with your {{ divorceWho }}, you may want to consider asking their family, friends and workplace if they have a new address, and provide that to the court.
content.noResponseOptions: If there’s still no response using the original address, you have the following options available to you, depending on your situation.

haveAnotherAddress.linkSummary: I have another residential address or a solicitor’s address for my {{ divorceWho }} (no fee)
haveAnotherAddress.provideAddress: Contact the Courts and Tribunals Service Centre to provide a different address for your {{ divorceWho }}. This can be a UK or international address.
haveAnotherAddress.noExtraPay: You don’t have to pay anything extra to have the application sent to a different address.

sendToWorkAddress.linkSummary: I need to send the application to a non-residential address, eg a work address (£{{ feeToResendApplication }})
sendToWorkAddress.askToSendApp: You can ask for the application to be sent to a non-residential address.

needToSearchRecords.linkSummary: I need to search government records for my {{ divorceWho }}’s address (£{{ feeToResendApplication }})
needToSearchRecords.canApplyIfRespLivesInEngWales: You can apply for a search of government databases (eg the electoral role) for your {{ divorceWho }}’s address. Your {{ divorceWho }} must live in England or Wales.
needToSearchRecords.applyViaSearchRecords: Contact the service centre and ask for the form to be sent to you.

sendEmailToResp.linkSummary: I need to send the application to my {{ divorceWho }}’s email address (£{{ feeToResendApplication }})
sendEmailToResp.appToEmail: You can ask for the application to be delivered by email.

believeRespChoseNotToRespond.linkSummary: I believe my {{ divorceWho }} lives at that address, but chose not to respond (£{{ feeToEnforce }})
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.deliverPapersDirectlyToResp: If you think that your {{ divorceWho }} is deliberately not responding you can pay a professional to deliver (serve) the divorce papers directly to them.
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.optionsToDeliver: You can do this by using either a:
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.courtEmpToDeliver: Court bailiff (an employee of the courts)
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.processServerDetails: Contact a local solicitor who should be able to give you the contact details for a local company.
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.courtBailiffCovid19: Given the current restrictions placed on bailiffs due to COVID-19 virus there has been potential concern about effecting personal service via bailiffs therefore can I please ask you to consider alternative service options as detailed on this landing page.
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.courtBailiffDetails1: The bailiff service can only be used at addresses in England and Wales where delivery by post has already failed. If you have a new address for your {{ divorceWho }}, you’ll have to get it delivered by post before you can apply for the bailiff service.
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.courtBailiffDetails2: If the bailiff succeeds in delivering the application, you’ll be given a letter as evidence that your {{ divorceWho }} has received the application. This is known as an 'endorsement of service'. If your {{ divorceWho }} doesn’t respond within 14 days of getting the application, you can use this letter to continue your divorce without their response.
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.formD89: form D89. Send the form to the Courts and Tribunals Service Centre.
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.moreToSend: You’ll also need to send the following:
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.divorceAppCopy: a copy of your divorce application

evidenceRespWontRespond.linkSummary: I have evidence that my {{ divorceWho }} received the application, but can’t or won’t respond (£{{ feeToResendApplication }})
evidenceRespWontRespond.canApplyForDeemedServ: If you know your {{ divorceWho }} received the application, but can’t or won’t respond, you can apply to the court for a ‘deemed service’. This means that the court will decide that your {{ divorceWho }} has received the application, and that you can continue without their response.
evidenceRespWontRespond.needToProve: You need to be able to prove that your {{ divorceWho }} received the application (eg, you have a text message from {{ divorceWho }} saying they received it).
evidenceRespWontRespond.applyAndSendDocs: Send the form and documents to the Courts and Tribunals Service Centre.

doneWithAllWaysOfDelivering.linkSummary: I’ve tried every possible way of delivering the application (£{{feeToResendApplication }})
doneWithAllWaysOfDelivering.askForDispenseWithService: Under exceptional circumstances, you can ask the court to ‘dispense with service’ (decide your {{ divorceWho }} doesn’t have to be served the divorce application).
doneWithAllWaysOfDelivering.allInCourtHands: It’s up to the court to decide whether to grant this. Before it can be considered, you’ll need to show that you’ve done everything you can to find them by contacting their:
doneWithAllWaysOfDelivering.searchInGovtDB: You’ll also need to have tried to find their address by searching for it on government databases.
doneWithAllWaysOfDelivering.applyD13bLink: form D13b.
doneWithAllWaysOfDelivering.applyD11AndD13bContent: Send the forms to the Courts and Tribunals Service Centre.

content.applyD11: form D11.
content.howToPayContent:
Call the service centre to make the £{{ feeToResendApplication }} payment by card (Monday, Wednesday and Friday -phones are open 8am-6pm and Webchat open 8am-8.
Tuesday and Thursday - Webchat and phones are open 8am-8pm.
Saturdays - Webchat and phones are open 8am-2pm.",) or include a cheque with your form.
content.howToPayBailiffContent:
Call the service centre to make the £{{ enforcementFee }} payment by card (Monday, Wednesday and Friday -phones are open 8am-6pm and Webchat open 8am-8pm.
Tuesday and Thursday - Webchat and phones are open 8am-8pm.
Saturdays - Webchat and phones are open 8am-2pm.",) or include a cheque with your form.
content.getNewRefNumb: If you’re eligible for help with fees you’ll need to apply again and get a new reference number.
content.extraCosts: If you asked the court to order your {{ divorceWho }} to pay your costs, then these extra costs will also be taken into account.
content.printAndSend: Send the form to the Courts and Tribunals Service Centre.
content.howToRespondLink: How your {{ divorceWho }} responds
content.decreeNisiLink: Decree nisi
content.decreeAbsoluteLink: Decree absolute
content.childrenAndDivorceLink: Children and divorce
content.moneyAndPropertyLink: Money and property

content.title: [CY] Your application has been refused
content.mainHeading: [CY] Your '{{ serviceName }}' application has been refused

serviceRefusalInfo.bailiff: [CY] The court has refused your application for '{{ serviceName }}'.
serviceRefusalInfo.deemed: [CY] The court has refused your application for '{{ serviceName }}' that your {{ divorceWho }} received the divorce application.
serviceRefusalInfo.dispensed: [CY] The court has refused your application to '{{ serviceName }}' that your {{ divorceWho }} doesn’t have to be served the divorce application.

content.refusalDocumentInfo: [CY] You can read the court’s reasons for this in the '{{ refusalDocumentLabel }}' document in 'Download your documents'.
content.infoToContactRespondent: [CY] If you still can’t get in contact with your {{ divorceWho }}, you may want to consider asking their family, friends and workplace if they have a new address, and provide that to the court.
content.noResponseOptions: [CY] If there’s still no response using the original address, you have the following options available to you, depending on your situation.
content.whichSituation: Pa sefyllfa sy’n berthnasol i chi?

haveAnotherAddress.linkSummary: Mae gen i gyfeiriad preswyl arall neu gyfeiriad arall ar gyfer cyfreithiwr fy {{ divorceWho }} (no fee)
haveAnotherAddress.provideAddress: Cysylltwch â’r Gwasanaeth Llysoedd a Thribiwnlysoedd i ddarparu cyfeiriad gwahanol ar gyfer eich {{ divorceWho }}. Gall hwn fod yn gyfeiriad yn y DU neu’n gyfeiriad rhyngwladol.
haveAnotherAddress.noExtraPay: Nid oes rhaid ichi dalu mwy i anfon y cais i gyfeiriad gwahanol.

sendToWorkAddress.linkSummary: Rwyf angen anfon y cais i gyfeiriad dibreswyl, e.e. cyfeiriad gwaith (£{{ feeToResendApplication }})
sendToWorkAddress.askToSendApp: Gallwch ofyn i’r cais gael ei anfon i gyfeiriad dibreswyl.

needToSearchRecords.linkSummary: Rwyf angen chwilio cofnodion y llywodraeth i ddod o hyd i gyfeiriad fy {{ divorceWho }} (£{{ feeToResendApplication }})
needToSearchRecords.canApplyIfRespLivesInEngWales: Gallwch wneud cais i chwilio cronfeydd data’r llywodraeth (e.e. y gofrestr etholwyr) i ddod o hyd i gyfeiriad eich {{ divorceWho }}. Mae’n rhaid bod eich {{ divorceWho }} yn byw yng Nghymru a Lloegr.
needToSearchRecords.applyViaSearchRecords: Cysylltwch â’r Gwasanaeth Llysoedd a Thribiwnlysoedd i ofyn iddynt anfon y ffurflen atoch.

sendEmailToResp.linkSummary: Rwyf angen anfon y cais i gyfeiriad e-bost fy {{ divorceWho }} (£{{ feeToResendApplication }})
sendEmailToResp.appToEmail: Gallwch ofyn i’r cais gael ei anfon drwy e-bost.

believeRespChoseNotToRespond.linkSummary: Credaf bod fy {{ divorceWho }} yn byw yn y cyfeiriad hwnnw, ond wedi penderfynu peidio ag ymateb (£{{ enforcementFee }})
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.deliverPapersDirectlyToResp: Os ydych yn credu bod eich {{ divorceWho }} yn peidio ag ymateb yn fwriadol, gallwch dalu i unigolyn proffesiynol ddanfon (cyflwyno) y papurau ysgariad yn uniongyrchol iddynt.
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.optionsToDeliver: Gallwch wneud hyn drwy naill ai ddefnyddio:
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.privateHireToDeliver: Cyflwynydd proses (unigolyn proffesiynol sydd wedi’i gyflogi’n breifat)
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.processServerDetails: Cysylltwch â chyfreithiwr lleol a ddylai allu rhoi manylion cyswllt cwmni lleol ichi.
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.courtBailiffCovid19: O ystyried y cyfyngiadau presennol a roddir ar feiliaid yn sgil y feirws COVID-19 mae pryderon wedi eu codi o ran defnyddio beiliaid ar gyfer gwaith personol. Gofynnir yn garedig i chi i ystyried dulliau eraill o wasanaeth fel a welir ar y dudalen lanio hon.
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.courtBailiffDetails1: Dim ond mewn cyfeiriadau yng Nghymru a Lloegr y gellir defnyddio’r gwasanaeth beili lle mae anfon y cais drwy’r post eisoes wedi methu. Os oes gennych gyfeiriad newydd ar gyfer eich {{ divorceWho }}, bydd rhaid anfon y cais drwy’r post i’r cyfeiriad hwnnw cyn y gallwch wneud cais am wasanaeth beili.
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.courtBailiffDetails2: Os yw’r beili’n llwyddo i ddanfon y cais, fe gewch lythyr fel tystiolaeth bod eich {{ divorceWho }} wedi cael y cais.  Gelwir hyn yn 'ardystiad cyflwyno'. Os na fydd eich {{ divorceWho }} yn ymateb ymhen 14 diwrnod iddynt gael y cais, gallwch ddefnyddio’r llythyr hwn i barhau gyda’ch ysgariad heb eu hymateb.
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.formD89: ffurflen D89. Anfonwch y ffurflen i’r Gwasanaeth Llysoedd a Thribiwnlysoedd.
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.moreToSend: Bydd angen ichi hefyd anfon y canlynol:

evidenceRespWontRespond.linkSummary: Mae gen i dystiolaeth bod fy {{ divorceWho }} wedi cael y cais, ond ni all neu nid yw am ymateb (£{{ feeToResendApplication }})
evidenceRespWontRespond.canApplyForDeemedServ: Os ydych yn gwybod bod eich {{ divorceWho }} wedi cael y cais, ond ni all neu nid yw am ymateb, gallwch wneud cais i’r llys am orchymyn 'cyflwyno tybiedig'. Golyga hyn y bydd y llys yn penderfynu bod eich {{ divorceWho }} wedi cael y cais, ac y gallwch barhau heb eu hymateb.
evidenceRespWontRespond.needToProve: Bydd angen ichi allu profi bod eich {{ divorceWho }} wedi cael y cais (e.e. mae gennych neges testun gan {{ divorceWho }} yn dweud eu bod wedi’i gael).
evidenceRespWontRespond.applyAndSendDocs: Anfonwch y ffurflen a’r dogfennau i’r Gwasanaeth Llysoedd a Thribiwnlysoedd.

doneWithAllWaysOfDelivering.linkSummary: Rwyf wedi rhoi cynnig ar bob ffordd bosibl o ddanfon y cais (£{{feeToResendApplication }})
doneWithAllWaysOfDelivering.askForDispenseWithService: O dan amgylchiadau arbennig, gallwch ofyn i’r llys 'hepgor cyflwyno' (penderfynu nad oes rhaid cyflwyno’r cais am ysgariad) i {{ divorceWho }}.
doneWithAllWaysOfDelivering.allInCourtHands: Y llys fydd yn penderfynu a ddylid caniatáu hyn ai peidio.  Cyn gall y llys ystyried hyn, bydd angen ichi ddangos eich bod wedi gwneud popeth y gallwch i ddod o hyd iddynt drwy gysylltu â’u:
doneWithAllWaysOfDelivering.searchInGovtDB: Bydd angen ichi hefyd fod wedi ceisio dod o hyd i’w cyfeiriad drwy chwilio amdano ar gronfeydd data’r llywodraeth.
doneWithAllWaysOfDelivering.applyD13bLink: ffurflen D13b.
doneWithAllWaysOfDelivering.applyD11AndD13bContent: Anfonwch y ffurflenni i’r Gwasanaeth Llysoedd a Thribiwnlysoedd.

content.applyD11: ffurflen D11.
content.howToPayContent: Ffoniwch y Gwasanaeth Llysoedd a Thribiwnlysoedd i dalu’r ffi o £{{ feeToResendApplication }} gyda cherdyn (rhwng 8.30am - 5pm) neu fel arall anfonwch siec gyda’ch ffurflen.
content.howToPayBailiffContent: Ffoniwch y Gwasanaeth Llysoedd a Thribiwnlysoedd i dalu’r ffi o £{{ enforcementFee }} gyda cherdyn (rhwng 8.30am - 5pm) neu fel arall anfonwch siec gyda’ch ffurflen.
content.getNewRefNumb: Os ydych chi’n gymwys i gael help i dalu ffioedd llysoedd a thribiwnlysoedd, bydd angen ichi wneud cais arall a chael cyfeirnod newydd.
content.extraCosts: Os gofynnoch i’r llys orchymyn bod eich {{ divorceWho }} yn talu’ch costau, yna bydd y costau ychwanegol hyn hefyd yn cael eu hystyried.
content.printAndSend: Anfonwch y ffurflen i’r Gwasanaeth Llysoedd a Thribiwnlysoedd.
content.howToRespondLink: Sut mae eich {{ divorceWho }} yn ymateb
content.decreeNisiLink: Dyfarniad Nisi
content.decreeAbsoluteLink: Dyfarniad Absoliwt
content.childrenAndDivorceLink: Plant ac ysgariad
content.moneyAndPropertyLink: Arian ac eiddo
